证据片段: oxides exceeded a critical thickness of 15 to 20 μm

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_017_chunk1
证据片段: average deuteriding rate in Zr-2.5Nb tubes was only 1.5 mg/kg per year

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_017_chunk1
证据片段: temperature of the heavy water on the inside of the pressure tube ranges from 523 K at the inlet to about 638 K at the outlet

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_017_chunk1
证据片段: oxide thickness of about 2 μm when the transition from a cubic rate first occurs

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_017_chunk1
证据片段: final linear rate is not achieved until the oxide film is about 30 μm thick

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_017_chunk2
证据片段: When the H:O ratio is kept low (oxidizing conditions), corrosion rates (nodular and uniform) are high but the percent hydrogen uptake is low

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_017_chunk2
证据片段: When the H:O ratio is kept high (reducing conditions), the corrosion is low and uniform but the percent hydrogen uptake is high

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_017_chunk2
证据片段: samples with oxides greater than 20 μm thick did not exhibit the expected reduction in corrosion rate when the water chemistry was changed from oxidizing to reducing

证据片段: Pressure tubes removed from the NRU research reactor, and the NPD, Pickering, and Bruce Nuclear Generating Stations have been examined in detail to obtain a better understanding of their long-term corrosion and deuteriding behavior

证据片段: For the high flux condition, the eventual uptake attained is about 80% of the theoretical compared to about 40% at the lower fluxes.

证据片段: The effect of fast neutron flux on corrosion and deuteriding processes appears to be much larger than the effect of temperature over the range 523 to 573 K

证据片段: After 3500 efpd, corrosion of Zr-2.5Nb was about one third of that for Zircaloy-2

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_017_chunk5
证据片段: the average deuteriding rate for cold-worked Zr-2.5Nb pressure tubes is only 1.5 mg/kg per year (or 0.75 mg/kg equivalent hydrogen per year)

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_017_chunk5
证据片段: the percentage uptake is less than 5% of the theoretical after nearly 10 full power years of operation.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_017_chunk6
证据片段: Deuterium pickup in garter springs can be minimized by ensuring that sufficient oxidant is present in the annulus gas to maintain a normal oxide film on these springs.
